Author: RamKakani
Description:
Oracle Database@Azure was purpose-built to enable enterprises to bring Oracle databases to Azure.

With this jointly engineered solution, customers can:

- Migrate existing Oracle databases to Azure for the same or better performance, resiliency, and microsecond latency without refactoring

- Continue using existing Oracle licenses through Bring Your Own License (BYOL) or choose license included options

- Modernize applications on Azure while preserving familiar Oracle tools, features, and operational practices

**Go deeper with our new technical webinar series**

Run Oracle Your Way—On Oracle Database@Azure is a 30minute technical deep dive series led by Oracle and Microsoft product managers. Each session focuses on a practical topic—from architecture and networking to performance, security, and day1 operations—with real-world guidance straight from the teams building the service.

Whether you’re planning your first Oracle Database@Azure deployment or optimizing an existing environment, these sessions provide hands-on insights into how to run Oracle databases on Azure—without compromise.

Register for the first webinar on **Wednesday, March 3** to hear directly from product leaders Tammy Bednar and Ram Kakani. Two sessions will be offered to accommodate different time zones and scheduling needs.

- March 3, 2026: [9 am Pacific Time](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/session-landing-page?p2_event_id=99945548743688966547432101903176718043&p2_join_yn=&p2_prev_page=3&clear=2&session=16211940468530&cs=1hka6Ip1XCX9zFBIdriAOQqB2tduPBOU76Gph7xxs1coWJzeO4Aqka_0CsaYhNvqJxS3cQaThUqMmbfWMDWf-1g)

- March 3, 2026: [8 pm Pacific Time](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/session-landing-page?p2_event_id=100068550827332254658276273904899784259&p2_join_yn=N&clear=RR,2&session=16211940468530&cs=16bit4TCyhObRuU_nc8SnCvra_ZoEFe_Pb7ZPmyW3ZN4IQO26UOFuwqNTjIGm8Sf98o3S8PjXEle9llZADthJmA)

**Learn more**

- Explore the [technical webinar series](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/series-landing-page?p5_series_id=99932240812899306737938491709256796595&session=16211940468530)

- Join us at our next [Oracle AI World Tour stop](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/oracleonazureblog/microsoft-hits-the-road-with-oracle-ai-world-tour-2026-/4477598) in London, Sydney, Abu Dhabi, New York City, or Tokyo

- Join our [LinkedIn Community](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/14707004/) to stay on top of the latest Oracle Database@Azure news
Title: Introducing Run Oracle Your Way on Oracle Database@Azure – a new technical webinar series
EnhancedContent:
## Oracle and Microsoft are excited to announce a new technical webinar series designed specifically for database and cloud practitioners.

Oracle Database@Azure was purpose-built to enable enterprises to bring Oracle databases to Azure.

With this jointly engineered solution, customers can:

- Migrate existing Oracle databases to Azure for the same or better performance, resiliency, and microsecond latency without refactoring

- Continue using existing Oracle licenses through Bring Your Own License (BYOL) or choose license included options

- Modernize applications on Azure while preserving familiar Oracle tools, features, and operational practices

**Go deeper with our new technical webinar series**

Run Oracle Your Way—On Oracle Database@Azure is a 30minute technical deep dive series led by Oracle and Microsoft product managers. Each session focuses on a practical topic—from architecture and networking to performance, security, and day1 operations—with real-world guidance straight from the teams building the service.

Whether you’re planning your first Oracle Database@Azure deployment or optimizing an existing environment, these sessions provide hands-on insights into how to run Oracle databases on Azure—without compromise.

Register for the first webinar on **Wednesday, March 3** to hear directly from product leaders Tammy Bednar and Ram Kakani. Two sessions will be offered to accommodate different time zones and scheduling needs.

- March 3, 2026: [9 am Pacific Time](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/session-landing-page?p2_event_id=99945548743688966547432101903176718043&p2_join_yn=&p2_prev_page=3&clear=2&session=16211940468530&cs=1hka6Ip1XCX9zFBIdriAOQqB2tduPBOU76Gph7xxs1coWJzeO4Aqka_0CsaYhNvqJxS3cQaThUqMmbfWMDWf-1g)

- March 3, 2026: [8 pm Pacific Time](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/session-landing-page?p2_event_id=100068550827332254658276273904899784259&p2_join_yn=N&clear=RR,2&session=16211940468530&cs=16bit4TCyhObRuU_nc8SnCvra_ZoEFe_Pb7ZPmyW3ZN4IQO26UOFuwqNTjIGm8Sf98o3S8PjXEle9llZADthJmA)

**Learn more**

- Explore the [technical webinar series](https://asktom.oracle.com/ords/r/tech/catalog/series-landing-page?p5_series_id=99932240812899306737938491709256796595&session=16211940468530)

- Join us at our next [Oracle AI World Tour stop](https://techcommunity.microsoft.com/blog/oracleonazureblog/microsoft-hits-the-road-with-oracle-ai-world-tour-2026-/4477598) in London, Sydney, Abu Dhabi, New York City, or Tokyo

- Join our [LinkedIn Community](https://www.linkedin.com/groups/14707004/) to stay on top of the latest Oracle Database@Azure news

Updated Feb 24, 2026
